intro: Gnidiopsis styphelioides, commonly known as the rock fig, is a shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Moraceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces edible fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its unique morphology makes it a valuable species for ecological studies and horticultural use.
